pages.text: Obamus coronatus comes from the Upper Ediacaran, with fossils found in the Flinders Ranges, South Australia. It is a torus-shaped lifeform, that could grow up to 2 cm in diameter, and possibly partook in filter-feeding from the surrounding water. And no, they're not edible. The generic name derives from the Latinised surname of President Barack Obama, who is passinonate about sciences. The specific name derives from the Latin word 'coronatus', to mean 'wreath.
